etymology.description: semantic: 阝(阜) (fù, "mound") + phonetic: 東(東) (dōng, "east") = a place with mounds; display or state in an orderly manner
etymology.interpretation: The character 陈(陳) (chén, "old; aged; display; state") combines the semantic component 阝(阜) (fù, "mound"), suggesting a place or terrain, with the phonetic component 東(東) (dōng, "east"), which contributes to the pronunciation. This combination conveys ideas of arranging or displaying things in an orderly manner, evoking a sense of structure.
etymology.simplification: 陳(陳)→陈(陳): The simplified character retains the phonetic 東(東) (dōng, "east") while using a simplified form of 阝(阜) (fù, "mound"). This change likely reduces strokes while maintaining phonetic cues.

examples.chinese: 那块木板显得十分陈旧(那塊木板顯得十分陳舊)。
examples.pinyin: Nà kuài mùbǎn xiǎnde shífēn chénjiù.
examples.english: That piece of wood looks very old.

examples.chinese: 博物馆陈列着古代文物(博物館陳列著古代文物)。
examples.english: The museum displays ancient cultural relics.

examples.chinese: 他把旧物陈设在书架上(他把舊物陳設在書架上)，表达出岁月的痕迹(表達出歲月的痕跡)。
examples.pinyin: Tā bǎ jiùwù chénshè zài shūjià shàng, biǎodá chū suìyuè de hénjì.
examples.english: He arranged the old items on the bookshelf, expressing the traces of time.
